intro: Palicourea calophylla, commonly known as Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are small, red berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Palicourea calophylla is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive.
